thread.title: 3 Swedish Hard Ciders to Pair With a Winter Meal - The New York Times
thread.title_full: 3 Swedish Hard Ciders to Pair With a Winter Meal - The New York Times

author: Florence Fabricant
title: 3 Swedish Hard Ciders to Pair With a Winter Meal - The New York Times
text: Photo Food-friendly Swedish Brannland Ciders have arrived in the United States. Credit Tony Cenicola/The New York Times Deliciously food-friendly Swedish Brannland Ciders have arrived in the United States. Pernilla Perle is a delicate dry but balanced fizzy pear cider with a gentle 8 percent alcohol level. A concentrated, winey-sweet ice cider (11.5 percent alcohol) with a slightly bitter apple-skin finish is labeled Iscider. Barrique is a rich, barrel-aged version of the ice cider, also 11.5 percent. Skurnik Wines is importing them: Brannland Ciders, Pernilla Perle, $18 for 750 milliliters; Iscider, $37 for 375 milliliters; Barrique, $34 for 187 milliliters, all at Terryâ€™s West Village Wines & Spirits, 35 Greenwich Avenue (Charles Street), 212-255-0222, terrysnyc.com .
